intro: Pavetta sansibarica var. rufipila, commonly known as the red-haired pavetta, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers and red-hairy stems, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
